sources.name: Eisensee and Strömberg (2007)
sources.description:
Data published by Eisensee and Strömberg (2007)
Data publisher's source The data was produced using disasters identified and documented by the Centre for Research on the Epidemiology of Disasters (CRED) between 1968 - 2002, and coverage in evening news broadcasts of major US networks as recorded by the Vanderbilt News Archives.
Link http://perseus.iies.su.se/~dstro/wpdisasters.pdf
Retrieved 2017-06-30

variables.name: Share in news (Eisensee and Strömberg 2007)
variables.description: This data is derived by considering ~5,000 natural disasters occurring between 1968 and 2002 and corresponding news coverage in major US networks.

variables.name: Fixed effects regression (Eisensee and Strömberg 2007)
variables.description: This data is derived by considering ~5,000 natural disasters occurring between 1968 and 2002 and corresponding news coverage in major US networks. Here, it is controlled for the number killed and affected, country, year, and month.

variables.name: Equal coverage casualties ratio (Eisensee and Strömberg 2007)
variables.description: The casualties ratio indicates how many casualties would make media coverage equally likely, all else equal (controlling for: the number killed and affected, country, year, and month).
